channel.title: Changkhui: Changkhui and Boy City Chan
channel.itunes:subtitle: Business Program
channel.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
channel.itunes:summary: Sorakon Adulyanontha, AKA Boy City Chan, is a well known columnist from the Matichon group, Thailand. He writes regularly in Matichon, Matichon Weekly and Prachachart Thurakit. He mainly writes about general business management and marketing, using the materials from numerous interviews he has accumulated over the years with Thai business key figures. His column is known for its witty comment and its sense of humour in telling a business story. The podcast is meant to be business-oriented, with the same look-and-feel of his columns.
channel.description: Sorakon Adulyanontha, AKA Boy City Chan, is a well known columnist from the Matichon group, Thailand. He writes regularly in Matichon, Matichon Weekly and Prachachart Thurakit. He mainly writes about general business management and marketing, using the materials from numerous interviews he has accumulated over the years with Thai business key figures. His column is known for its witty comment and its sense of humour in telling a business story. The podcast is meant to be business-oriented, with the same look-and-feel of his columns.

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 18: Prachachart Seminar, Prapas Chonsaranon part 2
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Seminar with Boy City Chan as the moderator
item.itunes:summary: This is the second and final part, Prapas Chonsaranon, a very famous creative thinker in the last two decades shared his creative thinking process and methods.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 18: Prachachart Seminar, Singha Indharachuto part 1
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Seminar with Boy City Chan as the moderator
item.itunes:summary: This is the first part, Dr.Singh Indharachuto, a well-known designer for his collections of products that are made of recycle materials.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 17: Prachachart Seminar, Day 1 - part 3
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Seminar with Boy City Chan as the moderator
item.itunes:summary: The talks were held at Prachachart Thurakit with khun Sorakorn Adulyanont and Thana Thienachariya as hosts for the day. The two guests were khun Worawit Siripak from Panyapuri and khun Ittipat Kulpongwanich from Taokaenoi.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 14: OCSC Seminar part3
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Seminar with Boy City Chan as the moderator
item.itunes:summary: The seminar was held at Office of Civil Service Commission (http://www.ocsc.go.th) on June 1, 2007. Our Boy City Chan was the host with 3 guest speakers; Thana Thienachariya, Patee Sarasin and Choke Bulkoon. We would like to thank the OCSC for the permission to put this on our podcast. This third episode was khun Choke Bulkoon from Chokechai Farm.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Seminar with Boy City Chan as the moderator
item.itunes:summary: The seminar was held at Office of Civil Service Commission (http://www.ocsc.go.th) on June 1, 2007. Our Boy City Chan was the host with 3 guest speakers; Thana Thienachariya, Patee Sarasin and Choke Bulkoon. We would like to thank the OCSC for the permission to put this on our podcast. For the first part, this was from Thana Thienacharity from DTAC.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 11: Thana of DTAC
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Talked about Thana Tienatchariya of DTAC
item.itunes:summary: Having a draft from Thana up-and-coming book about how he crafted HAPPY, Boy City Chan told how he first met Thana a few years ago. Thana seemed to be one of the next generation idols for Thai. Boy Cty Chan really enjoyed the draft and spoke highly of him.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 10: Boy City Chan and the RS CEO, Surachai Chetchotsak, part 3
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Boy City Chan and Surachi Chedchotesak
item.itunes:summary: The seminar was held at Khaosod newpaper on March 28, 2007. It was an interesting conversation. Surachai revealed what trigged him into changing the business model for RS. The conversation lasted 90 minutes, so we divided it into three files, one for each week.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 7: Uniforms
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Boy City Chan commented on various movements in Thai Banks
item.itunes:summary: We exchanged opinions about uniforms and the impact of the Yellow shirts phenomenon in Thailand.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 6: Thai Banks
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Boy City Chan commented on various movements in Thai Banks
item.itunes:summary: As requested from fans in our webboards, Boy City Chan gave some behind-the-scence in various Thai banks movements and also his opinions on some notable initiatvies, such as K Heroes from Kasikorn Banks and the famous rebranding movement from Bank of Adyddha.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 5: A Brief History of Boy City Chan
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Boy City Chan told his professional life story
item.itunes:summary: Boy City Chan told his life story, how he started his journalisam life. This was a brief interview, focusing on his Matichin experience. Interestingly, he started work at Matichon group in the Prachachart Thurakit and had been transferred to the publishing house and Matichon Weekly.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 4: Ads and Expectation
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Advertisement Impact on Customers' Expectation
item.itunes:summary: How did you feel when you bought a product that never deliver what the ads promised. How often did that happen? We talked about some ads that were impressive and could lead to high customer expectation.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 3: CEO and Advertising
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Impact of using CEO on Advertising
item.itunes:summary: The topic was a suggestion from our webboard, http://www.changkhui.com/smf. Khun BOY suggested if using CEO in advertising was a good idea. Here we used DTAC's CEO Sigve Brekke and Tan Passakornnathee as examples. We discussed pros and cons and ended up with the ads or the annoucement that really needed the CEO in it.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 2: JatukamRamathep
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: An introduction to the hype of Jatukam RamaThep
item.itunes:summary: Passakorn really did not know about Jatukam Ramathep, but he say it on Matichon Weekly cover, so he asked our Boy City Chan to explain. Surprisingly, BCC did not know much either. So he told us what he knew and explain about the hype. We also put in some old tape to share you some of his other stories.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan 1: The Business of Software
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Comment on the observation made by the book The business of software
item.itunes:summary: In keeping with the tradition of a tech-based podcast, we discussed about the observation made in the book the business of software by Michael A. Cusumano. Sorakon also made some observations about China and Japan.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management

item.title: Changkhui and Boy City Chan beta 1: TV Experience and a Glimpse of Tan
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Sorakon Adulyanontha in Talk Radio
item.itunes:summary: BoyCityChan shared his experience in hosting a TV show at Channel 11. He revealed why he quitted the program, simply put, a live program was not his cup of tea. He then told us some stories of Tan Passakornnathree of the Oishi group, the guy whom he managed to know quite well since he had written a biography.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Business, Matichon, Marketing, Management
